      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String accountTypeGen()
      accountTypeGen used for testing account creation, this method returns a bank account type chosen at random from a pre-defined array by returning the String at a randomly chosen index.
      java.lang.Integer acctGen()
      acctGen generates a random integer between 100,000,000 and 199,999,999 to be used as an account number and as the key associated with the account.
      java.lang.String emailGen()
      informationGen used for testing menu navigation and login functionality, this method returns a bank account type chosen at random from a pre-defined array by returning the String at a randomly chosen index.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomGenerator

        public RandomGenerator()

    • Method Detail

      • acctGen

        public java.lang.Integer acctGen()
        acctGen generates a random integer between 100,000,000 and 199,999,999 to be used as an account number and as the key associated with the account. A vector (acctNumberList) keeps track of all account numbers already generated. Each time a new account number is generated, the method checks the vector for that account number. If the vector contains the account number, a new one is generated until one is found that is not taken.
        Returns:
        returns the generated account number

      • nameGen

        public java.lang.String nameGen(int minLength,
                                int maxLength)
        nameGen generates pseudo-name for randomly created customers.
        Parameters:
        minLength - minimum length of the name to be created
        maxLength - max length of the name to be created
        Returns:
        returns the generated name

      • getDubs

        public double getDubs(double min,
                      double max)
        getDubs returns a randomly created double with a specified minimum and maximum value.
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum desired value of the double
        max - the maximum desired value of the double
        Returns:
        random double between the specified boundaries

      • getInts

        public int getInts(int min,
                   int max)
        getInts returns a randomly generated integer between the specified boundaries
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum desired value of the integer
        max - the maximum desired value of the integer
        Returns:
        returns the integer generated within the desired boundaries

      • passwordGen

        public java.lang.String passwordGen(int minLength,
                                    int maxLength)
        passwordGen generates a password for randomly created customers. Contains numbers and letters and is between a specified min and max length
        Parameters:
        minLength - the minimum desired length for the password
        maxLength - the maximum desired length for the password
        Returns:
        returns the String password with a length within the desired boundaries

      • accountTypeGen

        public java.lang.String accountTypeGen()
        accountTypeGen used for testing account creation, this method returns a bank account type chosen at random from a pre-defined array by returning the String at a randomly chosen index. This method may also generate "RETURN" to prevent the customer from getting stuck in infinite loops during trials
        Returns:
        returns SAVINGS, CHECKING, IRA, CD, MMA, or RETURN

      • emailGen

        public java.lang.String emailGen()
        informationGen used for testing menu navigation and login functionality, this method returns a bank account type chosen at random from a pre-defined array by returning the String at a randomly chosen index. This method may also generate "RETURN" to prevent the customer from getting stuck in infinite loops during trials
        Returns:
        returns CHEX, CREDIT, ACCOUNTS, ALL, or RETURN
